name: AI Trust, Risk, and Security Management
description: Ensuring AI models are trustworthy, fair, reliable, robust, and private — with governance frameworks to manage AI risk across the organization.
accuracyNote: Repeat from 2023. EU AI Act was already passed by this point. Observing ongoing regulatory momentum is continuation, not prediction.

name: Continuous Threat Exposure Management
description: A pragmatic, systemic approach to continuously prioritizing and optimizing security threat remediation based on actual exposure and business risk.
accuracyNote: Accurate — attack surface management and continuous security assessment tools gained traction. Organizations shifted from periodic pentests to continuous exposure monitoring.

name: Sustainable Technology
description: Technology solutions that improve energy efficiency, enable circularity, and help organizations meet ESG goals while managing AI's growing energy footprint.
accuracyNote: Increasingly relevant — AI's massive energy consumption made sustainable computing critical. Green data centers and energy-efficient AI became major investment areas.

name: Platform Engineering
description: Self-service internal developer platforms with curated toolchains, golden paths, and infrastructure automation to improve developer productivity.
accuracyNote: Platform engineering is real but this is essentially the same prediction from 2023 repeated. Backstage launched in 2020 — the trend was already well-known. Predicting continuation of an existing trend doesn't warrant a 5.

name: AI-Augmented Development
description: AI coding assistants and generative AI tools would significantly accelerate software development, from code generation to testing to documentation.
accuracyNote: Massive hit — GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Claude Code, and other AI development tools became essential. AI-augmented development is now the default mode for most developers.

name: Industry Cloud Platforms
description: Cloud platforms combining IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS with industry-specific data models, business logic, and compliance features for vertical markets.
accuracyNote: Growing — healthcare, financial services, and manufacturing cloud platforms from AWS, Azure, and Google expanded their industry-specific offerings.

name: Intelligent Applications
description: Applications with embedded AI that learn, adapt, and autonomously take action to augment or automate work across every enterprise function.
accuracyNote: Every major SaaS product added AI features, true. But much of it is superficial 'add a Copilot button' integration. The prediction says apps that 'learn, adapt, and autonomously take action' — most AI features are glorified autocomplete or chatbot wrappers, not autonomous agents.

name: Democratized Generative AI
description: Generative AI would become accessible to all knowledge workers through cloud APIs, pre-trained models, and natural language interfaces.
accuracyNote: Completely realized — ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, and open-source models made generative AI universally accessible. Anyone can now use AI without technical expertise.

name: Augmented Connected Workforce
description: Using AI, analytics, and smart applications to provide context and guidance to workers, improving their ability to learn, make decisions, and collaborate.
accuracyNote: Accurate — AI assistants for customer service, coding, writing, and analysis became standard workplace tools. The augmented worker is real.

name: Machine Customers
description: AI agents acting as autonomous economic actors — making purchases, negotiating contracts, and conducting transactions on behalf of humans or organizations.
accuracyNote: Too early — while AI agents can browse and research, autonomous machine purchasing at scale hasn't materialized. Interesting concept but premature for 2024.
